mainEntity.name: What is the difference between definite and indefinite integrals?

acceptedAnswer.text: An indefinite integral represents a family of functions (antiderivative) with a constant +C. A definite integral computes a numerical value representing the area under the curve between two bounds.

mainEntity.name: How does the calculator handle integration?

acceptedAnswer.text: The calculator applies power rule integration for polynomial terms, handles special cases like 1/x (natural logarithm), and evaluates definite integrals using the Fundamental Theorem of Calculus.

mainEntity.name: What convergence tests does the calculator support?

acceptedAnswer.text: The calculator supports the Ratio Test, Root Test, and Comparison Test for determining series convergence or divergence.

mainEntity.name: How do I interpret the convergence result?

acceptedAnswer.text: If the limit L < 1, the series converges. If L > 1 or L is infinite, the series diverges. If L = 1, the test is inconclusive and another method is needed.
